results.title: American history X (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Kaye, John Morriseey, New Line Cinema and Turman-Morrissey Company
results.brief_description: Rage vented as racism. Derek Vinyard (Edward Norton) seeks retribution for his father’s murder, and through his distorted logic and his charismatic leadership qualities, commands a growing army of skinheads at Venice Beach, California. Nobody looks up to Derek as much as his younger brother Danny (Edward Furlong), despite the efforts of his mother and teacher to persuade him otherwise. What should have been a case of self-defence, Derek violently attacks and murders an African American attempting to break into his car. After spending 3 years in prison, everyone awaits his return; his gang, his violent girlfriend and his younger brother. But Derek no longer shares the same views he once embraced as a badge of honour. What follows is a race to save his Danny and his family from the violence he’d brought down on so many others. Script by David McKenna.

results.creator_credit: Mike Mansfield, Patrick Shart, Phillip Goodhand and VCL Communications

results.title: An Enemy of the people = Ganashatru
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray and National Film Development Corporation of India
results.brief_description: Adaptation of Henrik Ibsen’s play of the same name, spoken in Bengali dialogue with English subtitles. In this version of Ibsen’s play, Satyajit Ray has transposed the action to contemporary India. When Dr. Ashok Gupta, chief medical officer at the hospital in the West Bengal town of Chandipur, discovers that the local ‘holy waters’ are dangerously polluted, his efforts to solve the problem are blocked by powerful local interests determined that nothing shall interfere with the lucrative flow of pilgrims and tourists. Gupta is, however, eventually supported by a coalition of progressive local interests, and the scene is set for a powerful conflict between science and superstition, idealism and self-interest. A fine example of ‘late’ Ray, and a fascinating fusion of Ray and Ibsen. Satyajit Ray was awarded an Honorary Oscar in 1992. Stars Soumitra Chatterjee, Dhritiman Chatterjee, Deepankar De, Ruma Cuhathakurta and Mamta Shankta.

results.title: An Easy pill to swallow
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Arthur Hammond, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Canadians are avid consumers of tranquillisers. This documentary, in the form of an ongoing dialogue for and against drugs, introduces us to doctors and patients who approach the issue from different angles. An “easy” pill could be a dangerous one, especially if we take it for granted. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: An Awfully big adventure [J.R.R. Tolkien]
results.creator_credit: Julian Birkett, BBC and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: This episode from a series on the making of modern children’s literature looks at the work of John Ronald Reuel, writer of the biggest selling children’s book ever, “The Hobbit” and creator of Middle Earth. The program discusses his childhood and education, his passion with language and phonology and his time at the Somme. It also talks about his literary influences (particularly Old Norse and Anglo Saxon literature), the formation of the Inklings with C.S. Lewis, his relationship with Allen and Unwin, and the evolution of the “Silmarillion.” Excerpts from “The Hobbit” are read and the plot of “The Lord of the rings” outlined. The program questions why Tolkien has universal appeal and looks at the acceptance of his work by counter culture America in the 1960s.

results.title: An Asian Experience Slow Boat from Surabaya
results.brief_description: A documentary that paints a fascinating portrait of South East Asia. From the rivers of tangled lotus to golden pagodas, from steep rice terraces to rolling grasslands, Jack Pizzey blends the energy of the present with the majesty of the past, inquiring, observing and challenging the countries of South East Asia - Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam, Kampuchea and the Philippines. Rated: G

results.creator_credit: Mike West and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Strongman, Atlas, is the humorous animated host of this tour around the globe. Sounding like the recent movie hero “Rocky”, Atlas provides accurate information on weather, wind, tides, storms and general geography for each country he visits. The film combines animation and some short live-action segments.

results.title: An American werewolf in London [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Landis, George Folsey Jr and Lycanthrope Films
results.brief_description: David and Jack are two American backpackers off for a three-month trek of Europe. Whilst wandering the desolate English countryside they happen upon a quaint pub with a mysterious patron who warns them not to leave the road when walking after dark. Ignoring such advice (as characters in horror films always do), the two inevitably find themselves lost in the moors being circled by a strange beast who attacks and kills Jack. David wakes up in a London hospital with nasty scratch wounds to his cheek and shoulder, and Jack soon appears, freshly deceased and rapidly decomposing, to deliver the grim news that David will in fact turn into a werewolf the next full moon. David dismisses the encounter as a hallucination, but all indications point to lycanthrope. Cast includes: David Naughton, Jenny Agutter and Griffin Dunne.

results.title: An American tail: Fievel goes west
results.creator_credit: Phil Nibbelink, Simon Wells, Robert Watts, Steven Spielberg and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Fievel, the brave young mouse from the much loved “An American tail” returns in this Wild West adventure. Life is hard for the Mousekewitz family who struggle to make ends meet and to keep their dreams alive. Tanya wants to become a singer and Fievel wants to be like his hero Wylie Burp. Lured out West by crafty Cat R. Waul, Fievel uncovers a dastardly plot to turn new settlers into mouse burgers. With the help of his cat friend Tiger and the feared Wylie Burp, Fievel saves the day. Features the voices of James Stewart, John Cleese, Dom DeLuise and Amy Irving with Linda Ronstadt singing the song “Dreams to Dream”.
